snippet: Mr. Abd El Fattah, a blogger from a prominent family of writers and activists, was jailed under a new law restricting protests but released by a judge who cited potential “embarrassment.”
abstract: Egyptian court releases left-leaning activist Alaa Abd El Fattah from prison on bail; release is rare example of leniency in the thousands of cases of political dissenters arrested since military takeover in 2013.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Abd El Fattah, a blogger from a prominent family of writers and activists, was jailed under a new law restricting protests but released by a judge who cited potential “embarrassment.”

headline.main: Egyptian Activist Alaa Abd El Fattah Is Released on Bail
headline.print_headline: Egypt: Activist Is Released on Bail

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
